greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n modulo A002110(A257993(n)), a(0) = 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2310
formula: a(0) = 0, and for n >= 1, a(n) = n modulo A002110(A257993(n)).
mathematica: {0}~Join~Table[k = 1; While[! CoprimeQ[Prime@ k, n], k++]; Mod[n, Product[Prime@ i, {i, k}]], {n, 79}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jun 22 2017 *)
program: (define (A276094 n) (if (zero? n) n (let loop ((n n) (i 1) (pr 1)) (let* ((p (A000040 i)) (d (modulo n p))) (if (not (zero? d)) (* d pr) (loop (/ (- n d) p) (+ 1 i) (* pr p)))))))
from sympy import nextprime, primepi, primorial
def a002110(n): return 1 if n<1 else primorial(n)
def a(n): return 0 if n==0 else n%a002110(a257993(n))
print([a(n) for n in range(101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 22 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 22 2016
